title: Staggering U.S. Tariffs Begin as Trump Widens Trade War
summary: The duties, which the president announced last week, took effect for about 90 countries just after midnight.

title: Trump’s Tariff Gamble Puts America’s Ties With India at Risk
summary: As the president pursues his goals on Russia and trade, America’s relationship with an important partner in Asia could end up as collateral damage.

title: Trump Tells European Leaders He Intends to Meet With Putin and Zelensky
summary: If the meeting goes ahead as President Trump described, it will be the first in-person summit between an American and Russian president in more than four years.

title: Trump Announces Additional $100 Billion Apple Investment in U.S.
summary: The White House said the pledge would bring more of the company’s supply chain and advanced manufacturing to the United States.

title: Republicans Raise the Pressure on Texas Democrats to End Their Walkout
summary: The political and legal threats against Democrats who left Texas to protest a redrawn political map have gone further and faster than many anticipated.

title: Trump’s Redistricting Campaign Tests His Power in the States
summary: The effort by President Trump and his allies is the latest example of them trying to rewrite the rules to squeeze out every possible political advantage.

title: Where the Redistricting Wars Might Go After Texas
summary: Texas Democrats may have bought their party some time with their walkout, but both parties are mobilizing to redraw U.S. House maps ahead of the midterms.

title: Trump Weighs Getting Involved in New York City Mayor’s Race
summary: The possibility that the president will seek to intercede could inject an element of unpredictability into an already fractious contest.

title: Cuomo Tells Business Leaders That His Campaign Is on a New Path
summary: Former Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo acknowledged that he had not run an effective race in the mayoral primary and asked for executives’ help to defeat Zohran Mamdani.

title: Eric Adams Is Again Denied Public Matching Funds for His Campaign
summary: Mayor Eric Adams of New York was dealt another setback in his long-shot campaign for re-election when he was denied millions of dollars in public matching funds.

title: Aldi’s Passionate, Cultlike Following Fuels Its Rapid Expansion Plans
summary: “It feels like I’m at a bougie store, but I’m not paying bougie prices,” one shopper said of the discount grocer, which is set to open hundreds of stores as consumers look to save and buy organic.

title: China Turns to A.I. in Information Warfare
summary: Documents examined by researchers show how one company in China has collected data on members of Congress and other influential Americans.

title: Federal Agents in L.A. Conduct a Big Immigration Raid at a Home Depot
summary: A rented Penske truck was used to ferry agents to the Home Depot where the raid was conducted, days after an appeals court upheld an order limiting some enforcement tactics.

title: Eddie Palmieri, Latin Music’s Dynamic Innovator, Dies at 88
summary: He roped salsa into conversation with jazz, rock, funk and even modern classical music. “A new world music,” one critic said, “is being born.”

title: Eddie Palmieri’s 13 Essential Songs and Albums
summary: A native son of the Bronx, Palmieri was a crucial innovator in New York’s Afro-Caribbean music history. The pianist, composer and bandleader has died at 88.

title: Trump Spending Bill Means Big Cuts for New Mexico
summary: Health care. Food. Outdoor recreation. Wildfire protection. The arts. President Trump’s new domestic policy law will have wide-ranging effects in New Mexico, which depends heavily on federal funding.

title: A Sergeant Is Accused of Shooting 5 Soldiers in His Unit at Fort Stewart
summary: The suspect’s father said he was seeking a transfer from the Army base in Georgia, where he had complained of racism.

title: I’ve Seen How Russia Is Torturing Prisoners of War
summary: Prosecuting torture is a legal obligation, not a diplomatic nicety or something that can be negotiated.

title: They Let Their Children Cross the Street, and Now They’re Felons
summary: They went to jail when their boy was killed. Why don’t road planners bear some guilt?

title: Huckabee Says U.S.-Backed Aid Sites in Gaza Will ‘Scale Up’
summary: The Gaza Humanitarian Foundation will soon operate 16 distribution sites instead of four, said Mike Huckabee, the United States ambassador to Israel.

title: United Airlines Resumes Operations After System Outage
summary: The Federal Aviation Administration said late Wednesday that delays may continue as the airline works through the recovery process.

title: New Zealand Air Force Mounts Dangerous Rescue Mission in Antarctica
summary: Three staff members from the National Science Foundation were evacuated from a U.S. research base after a medical emergency. The mission is one of the most challenging for the air force.

title: On the Hunt for Spies, Iran Executes a Nuclear Scientist
summary: After the war with Israel, Iranian authorities have swept up hundreds of people deemed suspected infiltrators. But the arrest and hanging of the nuclear scientist Roozbeh Vadi was a rare move.
